a.title: Introduction to the Angular documentation

Beyond the basics.

a.title: Take a look at Angular's component model, template syntax, and component communication.
Navigate among different page views using the browser's URL.
Use services and access external data via HTTP.

button.title: The Tour of Heroes app is used as a reference point in many Angular examples.

Creating the application shell
Part 1: Build a simple editor

Part 5: Add the Angular router and navigate among the views.
Part 6: Use HTTP to retrieve and save hero data.

a.title: Property binding helps show app data in the UI.

button.title: Syntax to use in templates for binding, expressions, and directives.

Introductory guide to coordinating app values.
Introductory guide to setting element or input properties.
Introductory guide to setting the value of HTML attributes.
Introductory guide to listening for user interaction.

Introductory guide to sharing data between parent and child directives or components.
Introductory guide to transforming data, ensuring safe navigation, and guarding against null variables in templates.
Guide to using SVGs as templates to create interactive graphics.
User input triggers DOM events. Angular listens to those events with event bindings that funnel updated values back into your app's components and models.
Attribute directives attach behavior to elements.
Structural directives manipulate the layout of the page.
Pipes transform displayed values within a template.
Angular calls lifecycle hook methods on directives and components as it creates, changes, and destroys them.
Share information between different directives and components.
Add CSS styles that are specific to a component.
Load components dynamically.
Convert components to Custom Elements.

button.title: Forms creates a cohesive, effective, and compelling data entry experience.

button.title: Dependency Injection: creating and injecting services
